result.execSummary:
The defendant Chance C McLaurin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide a  DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 6/1/16 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chance C McLaurin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chance C McLaurin in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Chance C McLaurin in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 5 months at the House of Correction with 104 days credit; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 6-1-16 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended  Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.

Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.

Defendant Chance C McLaurin in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Chance C McLaurin in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Court AMENDS the charge to Fourth Degree Sexual Assault 940.225(3m) a Class A misdemeanor.   Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chance C McLaurin in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Chance C McLaurin in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense moves for an adjournment for further investigation.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Chance C McLaurin not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Chance C McLaurin not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chance C McLaurin in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Chance C McLaurin in custody.  Jennifer Williams for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44. Scheduling Conference scheduled for April 02, 2015 at 08:30am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: EAM
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Chance C McLaurin in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  
Defendant Chance C McLaurin in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Chance C McLaurin
Current: 2221 North 38th Street Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 03-03-2015)
Prior: 2221 North 38th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
